```{r, message = FALSE, warning = FALSE}
library(tidyverse)
library(rvest)
```

## z-scores

```{r, message = FALSE, warning = FALSE}
x_vec = rnorm(25, mean = 5, sd = 4)

(x_vec - mean(x_vec)) / sd(x_vec)

z_scores = function(x) {
  z = (x - mean(x)) / sd(x)
  return(z)
}

z_scores(x = x_vec)

y_vec = rnorm(40, mean = 12, sd = 0.3)

z_scores(y_vec)
```



```{r, message = FALSE, warning = FALSE}

mean_and_sd = function(x) {
  if (!is.numeric(x)) {
    stop("x needs to be numeric")
  }
  if (length(x) < 3) {
    stop("x should have at least 3 numbers")
  }
  mean_x = mean(x)
  sd_x = sd(x)
  
  output_df = 
    tibble(
      mean = mean_x,
      sd = sd_x
    )
  return(output_df)
}

mean_and_sd(x_vec)
mean_and_sd(y_vec)

```

## Different sample sizes, mean and sd

```{r, message = FALSE, warning = FALSE}
sim_data =
  tibble(
    x = rnorm(30, mean = 2, sd = 3)
  )

sim_data %>%
  summarize(
    mean = mean(x),
    sd = sd(x)
  )

```

## Lets write a function that simulates data, computes the mean and sd

```{r, message = FALSE, warning = FALSE}
sim_mean_sd = function(n, mu, sigma) {
  # do checks on inputs
  
      sim_data =
      tibble(
        x = rnorm(n = n, mean = mu, sd = sigma)
      )
    
    sim_data %>%
      summarize(
        mean = mean(x),
        sd = sd(x)
      )
}

sim_mean_sd(30, 5, 2)

```
